reviews.text: Excellent
Reliable menu with lots of options.  Consistent in portion and flavor. Health conscious with plenty of vegetables.  Great service.

Very lovely place. Everything we ordered was fresh and tasty.
Rolls didn‚Äôt have too much rice, so just great.
Very friendly and fast service.
They have both inside and outside seating areas

We love coming to Saketumi. The food is excellent and the sashimi is always perfect but our very favourite thing is the waitstaff! They are so kind and make a huge effort to entertain our toddler and make sure that he has a great time. Highly recommend getting the Bento box dinner as well as the sake jelly shots.

I'm telling all my friends they need to try this place. The employees pair their friendly attitudes with good looks. You can taste the care in fresh preparation. This place fulfilled my dining wishes. To be direct: Saketumi Asian Bistro is wonderful.
Waitresses are very rude about tipping

Great lunch $15 incl tax
Large mini smorgasbord
The sushi was amazing, and the service was great. I highly recommend.
Goated place to to with friends. Food is amazing
Great japanese food in neighborhood. So many options, very high quality. Staff is very nice. Love coming here. And ordering delivery.
I love this place. The food is great and the staff is so warm and friendly. It‚Äôs a great place.
Excellent value for money, with tasty food and a pleasant experience üòãüç£‚òï And there is an excellent ice cream store next door too üç®üç¶üçß
I loved it here last year and I love it this year! The workers are so incredible and the place is beautiful. Not too pricy but ofc you're paying for great service and food. Highly Recommend

Consistently good food and great service. I love the yaki soba chicken noodles and the miso soup. The chicken teriyaki bento box with sauce on the side is great. Generous portions. I ordered no rice no salad and racially received extra miso soup. Love this place!
Honestly some of the best sushi I have had in Brooklyn. Ordered it twice in the same 3 day period.

Incredible service
Great prices

The food is great, but the level of rudeness ruined the whole experience. It looks like they were rushing me, even though I got there at 9pm.
I feel that the waitress thought I was not ‚Äúfinancially appropriate ‚Äú to be in that area because I was not groomed, basically using shorts and a t-shirt.
Brooklyn Heights is a tourist spot, people go there to see the sunset, walk around Dumbo, cross the bridge‚Ä¶ if you open a restaurant there and your staff pre judge you for your clothes or your accent (I‚Äôm latina) then this is not your place.
Not mentioning that I order soup and she gave me salad, and the worst part was when she checked if I tipped her in front of me.

Don‚Äôt bother yourself going in person, ask for delivery lol
Ive done dine in and take out many times. Their food is absolutely incredible and consistent in taste and flavor. Whenever I'm in the area, I always make sure to stop by.
great food and service

This place is horrible the waiters make you wait too long and the server is rude. I swear I was left here from 20 minutes until I could order anything! My server is extremely rude and when I asked a question she was extremely snarky and rude.
This place is an absolute hidden gem. The BEST sushi for the BEST price in all of New York. The people who work here are amazing, as is the food they serve.
Delicious sushi and Japanese favorites and very fair pricing. Sushi bar and private garden area in back
Lovely spot, lovely staff, really good rolls, great lunchtime deal, nice back garden which is quiet - will be back!

Remarkably gracious and effective service to our rowdy crowd of 10 including four or five young people. Terrific value‚Ä¶ Go for the bento box, you will not be disappointed! In a way I felt like we were transported back in time 30 years given the prices and the portions. An absolute must hear in the Heights.
Unagi-don is definitely a go üëç
Great food quality, inexpensive, hot outdoor space,  eye quick service, quiet. Highly recommend. ü•∞üôè
Absolutely delicious! We got the bento katsu chicken lunch special and pineapple chicken fried rice. Thank you for the meal. We will be back <3
Love sushi here! Best sushi I've ever had.
Wonderful spot full of locals. Great gluten free and vegetarian options! Absolutely delicious.

This place has always been my Favorite spot!
The service in on Point, the food is delicious!  üòã  I enjoy the Avocado ü•ë  salad, their Seafood  Gravy, and SO Many other Yummy Foods!  I dod a "Pure Romance" Workshop amd they were Very  accommodating. I WOULD HIGHLY Recommend this Great Spot..You WON'T Regret it.. #SUPERYUMMY!

Absolutely fantastic experience at Saketumi! The sushi boat was incredible ‚Äì so fresh and beautifully presented. The salad was also a standout. Everything tasted amazing. Highly recommend for delicious and artfully prepared Japanese food! A real gem.

Very good! I ordered takeout here, so I can't speak much to the service or ambiance, but the food was great. I ordered one of their online lunch specials, two special rolls for $15 (came with salad). Excellent deal! I had the rainbow roll and the lobster tempura roll. Both were great.
Very good place 5 stars
Good
Good prices, decent portion sizes, really nice views. Would definitely visit again.
Lunch box is a great choice for fast and full feeling meal. Service is fast and friendly.
The food, service and prices are really good here
The lunch menu is delightful. I‚Äôm basic, so I love the tuna roll the best, but there were other very delicious sushi options to choose from
Great food, great service, very fast and reasonable prices. Popular neighborhood spot for good reason.
Love Saketumi! My fav sushi and they are so nice and accommodating. I can‚Äôt eat tuna due to pregnancy/breastfeeding and they always switch tuna out to salmon for me!

hands down the best

food 15/10
Service 15/10
Attention to detail 15/10

Stopped by for a solo quick bite before an event in the neighborhood. The waitstaff were super warm and attentive. Since it was the day before LNY, they wished me a happy new year! I had the dinner bento w. beef negimaki and tofu teriyaki. The portion size is large.

On a separate note, they really care for their customers. They even went out of their way to call a cab for a regular who had a little too much to drink.
Had a wonderful Christmas dinner here! Everything was delicious, but we were especially impressed with the grilled Hamachi Kama. It was so delicious and reasonably priced.
Such good food and good people!!!
The service was incredibly disappointing. The waitress was rude and pushy about the tip, which made the entire experience unpleasant.
Small spot walking distance from the Brooklyn Promenade that boasts an intimate atmosphere. The food was good, basic sushi. The green tea was lovely.
Best Sushi in BK HEIGHTS!!!! Love the food, excellent service. Everyone is very friendly. Definitely coming back and bringing friends to the back patio!!!
Very basic, but clean, friendly. Reasonable prices.
Got food poisoning and have had diarrhea since thursday. It‚Äôs now saturday and my stomach has still not recovered. The raw scallops were probably not fresh, never going back again.
A friendly family run restaurant. Very tasty. Quality is consistent.

LOVE THIS SPOT! The food is amazing, the service is quick and the space is perfect for a date. This is the best pad Thai I‚Äôve had and I‚Äôm not a huge pad Thai fan but this one was delicious. We also had their sushi maki rolls and basil fried rice and the chef did not miss a beat! If you are in the area treat yourself to dinner! The prices are super affordable.

Love the food & service! The servers do their absolute best for the customers and always make you feel welcomed. One of my favorite go to's for lunch. Menu is consistent and food is always delicious!! Definitely a great place for sushi!!
I came to this restaurant with my family. Their service is really friendly and recommended us a lot of good food. The dishes were delicious, just as they recommended. Thank you so much!
I‚Äôve been coming here for years, and have tried a good part of the menu. The food is great and the service is even better. Highly recommend.
Delicious and such a good price. $10 for a big portion and high quality lunch. The friendliest staff. Highly recommend for anyone visiting Brooklyn.

This place is absolutely amazing. The staff is incredibly nice and courteous; the food is also equally amazing. The prices are decent and the plate presentation is actually very nice. The only thing I would suggest is making the portions bigger. Overall it was an awesome dinning experience

Uczta dla podniebienia i d≈Çugo wspominana wysoka jako≈õƒá obslugi.
Bistro oferuje sushi przygotowywane w otwartej kuchni. Ponadto dania kuchni tajskiej. Wybornie smakujƒÖ pierogi, sushi z ≈Çososiem, a tak≈ºe pad taj z kurczakiem i mango.
Miejsce godne uwagi w trakcie spacer√≥w po Brookli≈Ñskich ulicach.

We were happy to receive such a great amount of food for a fantastic price range. The atmosphere was relaxing and comfortable, and although we did come at a quiet mid day hour, wait staff was attentive and extremely kind! The tempura udon‚Ä¶

Probably one of the most disappointing dinners I had here.

Looking at the menu the rack of lamb was recommended as the restaurant specialty. Prepared with red wine sauce. I had great expectations.

‚ÄúGrilled Lamb Rack With Red Wine Sauce Dinner Specialty.  $23.95‚Äù

What I got was a far cry from that description.  A cold, over cooked, dry and hard pieces of lamb ribs over some greens.

Claiming it to be the ‚ÄúHouse Specialty‚Äù made that disappointment worse.

(Unfortunately I took the pictures after I dosed the poor dead lamb with the sauce in an attempt to revive it)
We ate on the back patio and had such a lovely experience! The staff was friendly and we had a great meal for pretty cheap. Walking distance from the bridge so it's a great date spot!

Should be 3.5 stars. 0.5 stars for a cute fresh fruit desert surprise they added into our take out bag, a nice touch.
Cruspy duck salad was nothing like a picture on their order site, it is tempura duck pieces on a pillow of fresh pinach and greens. Quite chewy and not what expected.
Spicy sashimi appetizer was good (but not spicy) and came in the form of tuna and salmon stripes wrapped around smth looking like a tuna tartar. Inventive and not bad at all, but description was quite deceiving.
Seaweed salad on the contrary was spicier than usually in other places.
Mackerel sashimi was ok.
Pineapple fried rice with chicken was the only thing we really loved, lots of pineapple and chicken, very flavorful.
It was our 1st time ordering from this place so we enjoyed 10% off. The pickup was quick (20 min from order) and the lady at the counter was very polite.

Came here for Saturday lunch. They have lunch specials even on Saturday which was great. More delivery orders than sit downs so the restaurant was pretty empty. The staff were friendly and told me I can move seats if I was too cold. Ordered two maki rolls with soup and salad, and two rolls that were not on the specials. The lunch rolls were on the smaller side so if you‚Äôre hungry make sure to order 3 rolls! Overall good sushi.

A bit hard to find as it‚Äôs a step down entrance, but close to Borough Hall and lots of different transit options to get here without having to drive. I knew I had found a gem as it was packed throughout my whole meal. They‚Äôve got an extensive lunch specials menu I‚Äôve got to see! I highly recommend calling ahead for a table, especially if you come during their lunch or dinner rush. Service was excellent from walking through the door until I left. I started with their Amuse-bouche, which was an excellent pickled serving. Next came a Manhattan roll‚Äîsorry, I failed as I forgot to snap a picture. This was unique and very tasty. I really enjoyed the seaweed on the outside for the texture it gave as it seemed thicker and wider than most seaweed I‚Äôve had. This was quickly followed with my bowl of miso soup. This was the weakest part of the meal as it was lacking a depth of flavor, but I added a bit of wasabi from my roll plate and that really helped. My main course was the lunch special, Yaki Udon with shrimp. This was a large portion for the price and super tasty with veggies, noodles, a sauce, and shrimp.

As always, Saketumi is my favorite go-to Japanese Bistro downtown Brooklyn. My family & I decided to dine 2 nights in a row, yesterday and Tuesday night. I enjoy the freshness and enthusiasm in which they create their sushi rolls. The sashimi is always fresh & the presentation never disappoints.
I had the 18-piece sashimi platter with their "VCR roll" the first night, and Philadelphia, Dragon, eel and avocado, & (special) Saketumi rolls the second night.
5/5 for the food & service each time.
(Backyard dining is also now open.)
Shout out to the entire wait staff & sushi chefs. Much love to you all!!!
Staff was incredibly friendly, the atmosphere was very calm, and the food was amazing. Absolutely the best Thai curry noodle soup I've had in my life.

A wonderful restaurant tucked snuggly into Montique Street in Brooklyn Heights. The service was excellent. The food dishes were delicious.  A little small in space but very cozy. I enjoyed my dining experience at Saketumi.

This place offered a nice respite from the urban jungle surrounding it. We came here with a friend who worked nearby and visited regularly. His recommendation was excellent.

The space was welcoming and the Asian vibe was relaxing. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable. They provided menus right away and even assisted my wife...when my wife accidentally mistook the bench continuing along the wall and ended up sitting on the floor. They helped her up and apologized profusely. They also provided warm sanitizer wipes and water almost immediately. Then hit tea at my wife's request.

My friend ordered the Spicy Mango Shrimp because the ladies next to us ordered it and we were intrigued by both its presentation and smell.

I ordered the Brooklyn Roll and a side of the BBQ Squid. My wife ordered the Cucumber roll.

All food was delicious and the space began to fill up as others were drawn to the delectable cuisine. üëçüëç
Delicious sushi with fast service and amazing prices! I was surprised to see the pricing, but food was great. Miso soup was only $2.5 and it was very tasty.

The staff is extremely friendly and always a second away in case you need them. The prices for a restaurant in such a rich area are actually great. There are lunch specials even on weekends. The food tastes awesome.  I highly recommend.

Great service and good prices also. We ordered the Crispy Girl Roll, is very little spicy üå∂ and enjoy the texture. I actually made it spicy with a bunch of wasabi. The sashimi bowl had 18 pieces of different fish, was delicious. I loved this place and I‚Äôll probably go back.‚Ä¶
The food is always amazing and the staff is the highlight of the place! They are welcoming, jovial and personal. They provide a very loving family atmosphere.

With indoor and outdoor seating Saketumi is easily one of my favorites.  Dine in, pick-up or delivery. I have done all three many times and have NEVER had a bad meal. It has always been consistently good and to be honest that's the best‚Ä¶
We loved this place! Amazing food at a more than great price. If I was a local I would go there very very often üòä

Honestly the best Asian restaurant that i have found in brooklyn. I travel to Cobble hill just to eat at Saketumi!  You get cash backs too from Seated. You get GREAT Chinese food. From gyoza to soup to sesame chicken and most especially their sushis and sashimi!!! Been here like 3 times now.
Very nice staff and very good meals. Fantastic garden. Photos taken under yellow light in night. So the colours of meals are bit different

Cool little restaurant with a lot to choose from! I sat in the back courtyard and had a nice Beef Teriyaki Bento Box lunch. It was the perfect portion size for lunch and I was able to eat the entire meal and be full..
Friendly staff and atmosphere!

I‚Äôve been eating here 8 years, and This is hands down one of my favorite restaurants in nyc if not anywhere. I only dine in, as I love the staff, and it‚Äôs a 15 min walk from home. The Sashimi Deluxe is $20 for 18 pieces. The salmon tartare is a must for $9. Love their mushroom soup for $5. The blackened cod app is to die for. If I‚Äôm with friends, I‚Äôll order the Brooklyn Bridge boat for $49. Great share. I eat a lot of sushi all over the world, and I‚Äôm not really a roll guy. But everything I‚Äôve had here is great.

This place is awesome. They have everything, sushi, Malaysian, Thai, and the value is awesome, the waitresses are great. The sashimi deluxe is on $20
We added a couple of pieces.
They serve sake and beer and wine
Best value sushi in NYC. Probably Brooklyn Heights‚Äô best kept secret. Unpretentious and really niiice nigiri and sashimi. Easily worth at least two times as much as they‚Äôre charging
